20101228040115.000|20101228040117.000|TR0|nation.  Thousands of flights have been

20101228040119.000|20101228040121.000|TR0|airports were closed for much of today

20101228040141.000|20101228040144.000|TR0|questions about airport security.  These 
20101228040144.000|20101228040146.000|TR0|questions are being raised by a pilot who 
20101228040146.000|20101228040148.000|TR0|says he works for a major airline.  He 
20101228040148.000|20101228040150.000|TR0|says the Transportation Security 
20101228040150.000|20101228040152.000|TR0|Administration, the TSA, is not protecting 
20101228040152.000|20101228040155.000|TR0|the flying public; that while passengers 
20101228040155.000|20101228040157.000|TR0|and flight crews are subjected to 
20101228040157.000|20101228040159.000|TR0|pat-downs and body scans, ground crews are 
20101228040159.000|20101228040201.000|TR0|not.  So anybody on the tarmac could put 
20101228040201.000|20101228040203.000|TR0|explosives on a jet.
20101228040203.000|20101228040206.000|TR0|
20101228040206.000|20101228040208.000|TR0|His name is Chris Liu and until tonight he 
20101228040208.000|20101228040210.000|TR0|kept his identity a secret for fear he 
20101228040210.000|20101228040212.000|TR0|might lose his job.  To prove his point 
20101228040212.000|20101228040214.000|TR0|Liu took his cell phone camera around San 
20101228040214.000|20101228040217.000|TR0|Francisco International Airport to show 
20101228040217.000|20101228040219.000|TR0|what he says are loop holes and lapses in 
20101228040219.000|20101228040221.000|TR0|security.  He also narrated what he shot 
20101228040221.000|20101228040223.000|TR0|and posted it on YouTube late last month.

20101228040332.000|20101228040334.000|TR0|misleading information on SFO's security 
20101228040334.000|20101228040336.000|TR0|program."  It goes on.  "The video shows a 
20101228040336.000|20101228040338.000|TR0|door with a card swipe and suggests that 
20101228040338.000|20101228040340.000|TR0|access is gained to the airfield area 
20101228040340.000|20101228040343.000|TR0|through this door.  In fact, the door 
20101228040343.000|20101228040345.000|TR0|shown in the video provides access only to 
20101228040345.000|20101228040347.000|TR0|an employee lunchroom."
20101228040347.000|20101228040349.000|TR0|

20101228040354.000|20101228040356.000|TR0|airport and passengers don't see a lot of

20101228040358.000|20101228040400.000|TR0|backing that up.  Quote, "As to access 
20101228040400.000|20101228040402.000|TR0|control at SFO, TSA is confident in the

20101228040409.000|20101228040411.000|TR0|unseen."
20101228040411.000|20101228040414.000|TR0|
20101228040414.000|20101228040416.000|TR0|Prior to this incident Chris Liu was part 
20101228040416.000|20101228040418.000|TR0|of a program developed by the TSA that 
20101228040418.000|20101228040420.000|TR0|permitted him to carry a firearm in the 
20101228040420.000|20101228040422.000|TR0|cockpit.  But earlier this month, federal 
20101228040422.000|20101228040425.000|TR0|and local law enforcement officials showed 
20101228040425.000|20101228040427.000|TR0|up at his California home to retrieve his 
20101228040427.000|20101228040429.000|TR0|gun and badge.  He calls it punishment, 
20101228040429.000|20101228040431.000|TR0|retaliation for pointing out serious flaws 
20101228040431.000|20101228040433.000|TR0|in airport security.
20101228040433.000|20101228040436.000|TR0|
20101228040436.000|20101228040438.000|TR0|The TSA says it holds members of that 
20101228040438.000|20101228040440.000|TR0|program to the highest ethical standards 
20101228040440.000|20101228040442.000|TR0|and goes on to say that officers must be 
20101228040442.000|20101228040444.000|TR0|able to maintain sensitive security 
20101228040444.000|20101228040447.000|TR0|information and that it reviews each 
20101228040447.000|20101228040449.000|TR0|possible violation of those standards and 
20101228040449.000|20101228040451.000|TR0|acts accordingly.

20101228040905.000|20101228040907.000|TR0|won't say hundreds -- a lot of pilots -- 
20101228040907.000|20101228040909.000|TR0|who have all confirmed the same security 
20101228040909.000|20101228040911.000|TR0|problem exists. You know, I would say that 
20101228040911.000|20101228040913.000|TR0|San Francisco has a vested interest in 
20101228040913.000|20101228040916.000|TR0|spinning the story, because they have a

20101228040918.000|20101228040920.000|TR0|tactic.
20101228040920.000|20101228040922.000|TR0|

20101228040927.000|20101228040929.000|TR0|story is that pretty much everybody knows 
20101228040929.000|20101228040931.000|TR0|that we're not doing the job that we have 
20101228040931.000|20101228040933.000|TR0|to do and we're not screening the ground 
20101228040933.000|20101228040936.000|TR0|crew.
20101228040936.000|20101228040938.000|TR0|
20101228040938.000|20101228040940.000|TR0|So, we can -- we can make all the 
20101228040940.000|20101228040942.000|TR0|diversionary tactics we like.  The problem

20101228041940.000|20101228041942.000|TR0|MYERS:  Right.  Yes.
20101228041942.000|20101228041944.000|TR0|
20101228041944.000|20101228041946.000|TR0|KAYE:  All right, thanks, Chad, for that.
20101228041946.000|20101228041949.000|TR0|
20101228041949.000|20101228041951.000|TR0|MYERS:  You're welcome.  All right.
20101228041951.000|20101228041953.000|TR0|
20101228041953.000|20101228041955.000|TR0|KAYE:  And, as you said, New York took the 
20101228041955.000|20101228041958.000|TR0|brunt of it.  It normally takes it in 
20101228041958.000|20101228042000.000|TR0|stride.  Between the subways and utilities 
20101228042000.000|20101228042002.000|TR0|underground, snow rarely sticks to the 
20101228042002.000|20101228042004.000|TR0|streets once they get plowed.
20101228042004.000|20101228042006.000|TR0|
20101228042006.000|20101228042009.000|TR0|But, this time, it was snow, snow, more 
20101228042009.000|20101228042011.000|TR0|snow, and CNN's Mary Snow.
20101228042011.000|20101228042013.000|TR0|
20101228042013.000|20101228042015.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101228042015.000|20101228042017.000|TR0|
20101228042017.000|20101228042020.000|TR0|MARY SNOW, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over): 
20101228042020.000|20101228042022.000|TR0| Cars buried in snow, buses stranded and 
20101228042022.000|20101228042024.000|TR0|abandoned, one even caught fire after 
20101228042024.000|20101228042026.000|TR0|overheating.  New York City hammered with 
20101228042026.000|20101228042028.000|TR0|20-plus inches of powder and drifts even 
20101228042028.000|20101228042031.000|TR0|higher, with winds gusting over 35 miles 
20101228042031.000|20101228042033.000|TR0|per hour, a ghost town above grown, a 
20101228042033.000|20101228042035.000|TR0|commuter's hell under it.
20101228042035.000|20101228042037.000|TR0|
20101228042037.000|20101228042039.000|TR0|Hundreds of people were stranded on 
20101228042039.000|20101228042042.000|TR0|subways for hours.  New Yorker Ross Den 
20101228042042.000|20101228042044.000|TR0|captured these images.  Den says he and 
20101228042044.000|20101228042046.000|TR0|fellow passengers spent several hours on 
20101228042046.000|20101228042048.000|TR0|this subway, with no heat in freezing 
20101228042048.000|20101228042050.000|TR0|temperatures.
20101228042050.000|20101228042053.000|TR0|
20101228042053.000|20101228042055.000|TR0|The mayor called the storm one of the most 
20101228042055.000|20101228042057.000|TR0|challenging New York has seen in a decade, 
20101228042057.000|20101228042059.000|TR0|adding 911 emergency calls were running 
20101228042059.000|20101228042101.000|TR0|twice the normal rate.
20101228042101.000|20101228042104.000|TR0|
20101228042104.000|20101228042106.000|TR0|MICHAEL BLOOMBERG (I), MAYOR OF NEW YORK:  
20101228042106.000|20101228042108.000|TR0|Snow felt at -- fell at a furious rate of 
20101228042108.000|20101228042110.000|TR0|two or three inches an hour.  The snowfall 
20101228042110.000|20101228042112.000|TR0|was so heavy and so fast, that crews who 
20101228042112.000|20101228042115.000|TR0|were concentrating on plowing highways and 
20101228042115.000|20101228042117.000|TR0|primary streets often had to re-plow them 
20101228042117.000|20101228042119.000|TR0|repeatedly just to keep them open.
20101228042119.000|20101228042121.000|TR0|

20101228042553.000|20101228042555.000|TR0|Saturday afternoon, December 19, according

20101228042557.000|20101228042559.000|TR0|Department. Paramedics arrived eight

20101228042601.000|20101228042604.000|TR0|27-year-old mother and former model dead 
20101228042604.000|20101228042606.000|TR0|at 1:26.

20101228042637.000|20101228042639.000|TR0|matter of fact.
20101228042639.000|20101228042641.000|TR0|
20101228042641.000|20101228042643.000|TR0|WIAN:  Martin's death marks the second 
20101228042643.000|20101228042646.000|TR0|time that a woman Busch was seeing has 
20101228042646.000|20101228042648.000|TR0|died.  In 1983, while a student at the 
20101228042648.000|20101228042650.000|TR0|University of Arizona, Busch crashed his 
20101228042650.000|20101228042652.000|TR0|Corvette.  His 22-year-old female 
20101228042652.000|20101228042654.000|TR0|passenger was ejected and killed; Busch 
20101228042654.000|20101228042657.000|TR0|left the scene and was later found bloody, 
20101228042657.000|20101228042659.000|TR0|dazed and with a fractured skull.
20101228042659.000|20101228042701.000|TR0|
20101228042701.000|20101228042703.000|TR0|After a seven-month investigation, 
20101228042703.000|20101228042705.000|TR0|authorities dropped the case because of 
20101228042705.000|20101228042708.000|TR0|insufficient evidence.  In 1985, Busch was 
20101228042708.000|20101228042710.000|TR0|involved in a car chase on this highway 
20101228042710.000|20101228042712.000|TR0|with undercover narcotic detectives, who 
20101228042712.000|20101228042714.000|TR0|ultimately shot out his tire.
20101228042714.000|20101228042716.000|TR0|

20101228042723.000|20101228042725.000|TR0|Highway 40.

20101228042730.000|20101228042732.000|TR0|

20101228042734.000|20101228042736.000|TR0|Martin was found.  According to the police 
20101228042736.000|20101228042738.000|TR0|report, there were no apparent signs of 
20101228042738.000|20101228042741.000|TR0|trauma or other indications of cause of 
20101228042741.000|20101228042743.000|TR0|death.  Martin's ex-husband, who is a 
20101228042743.000|20101228042745.000|TR0|doctor, told "The Saint Louis 
20101228042745.000|20101228042747.000|TR0|Post-Dispatch" that she had a heart rhythm 
20101228042747.000|20101228042750.000|TR0|disorder called long QT syndrome that, in 
20101228042750.000|20101228042752.000|TR0|some cases, can cause sudden death.
20101228042752.000|20101228042754.000|TR0|
20101228042754.000|20101228042756.000|TR0|She had been dating Busch, the former CEO 
20101228042756.000|20101228042758.000|TR0|of Anheuser-Busch, for a year.

20101228042933.000|20101228042935.000|TR0|month under suspicion of kidnapping a baby 
20101228042935.000|20101228042938.000|TR0|boy from the hospital where he 
20101228042938.000|20101228042940.000|TR0|volunteered.  No charges have been filed.  
20101228042940.000|20101228042942.000|TR0|In fact, there's no evidence the boy was 
20101228042942.000|20101228042944.000|TR0|kidnapped.  The hospital says the child 
20101228042944.000|20101228042946.000|TR0|died and was cremated because the father 
20101228042946.000|20101228042949.000|TR0|would not claim the remains.
20101228042949.000|20101228042951.000|TR0|
20101228042951.000|20101228042953.000|TR0|The founder of WikiLeaks has reportedly

20101228043548.000|20101228043550.000|TR0|So, in 2009 Democrats dropped end-of-life 
20101228043550.000|20101228043553.000|TR0|planning provision from the reform package 
20101228043553.000|20101228043555.000|TR0|altogether.  Fast forward to Christmas Day 
20101228043555.000|20101228043557.000|TR0|2010, just two days ago, when this article

20101228043559.000|20101228043601.000|TR0|stripping end-of-life counseling from the 
20101228043601.000|20101228043604.000|TR0|health care reform bill signed into law

20101228043606.000|20101228043608.000|TR0|forward with the plan.
20101228043608.000|20101228043610.000|TR0|
20101228043610.000|20101228043612.000|TR0|As of January 1st, the government will pay 
20101228043612.000|20101228043615.000|TR0|doctors who advise their Medicare patients 
20101228043615.000|20101228043617.000|TR0|on end-of-life care options.  It's all 
20101228043617.000|20101228043619.000|TR0|part of a new Medicare policy folding what 
20101228043619.000|20101228043621.000|TR0|the government calls voluntary advanced 
20101228043621.000|20101228043623.000|TR0|care planning into each Medicare patient's 
20101228043623.000|20101228043626.000|TR0|annual check-up.  In other words, the 
20101228043626.000|20101228043628.000|TR0|White House is doing by regulation, what 
20101228043628.000|20101228043630.000|TR0|Congress could not do by legislation.
20101228043630.000|20101228043632.000|TR0|
20101228043632.000|20101228043634.000|TR0|But the White House is quick to deny 
20101228043634.000|20101228043637.000|TR0|credit.  According to a spokesman, the 
20101228043637.000|20101228043639.000|TR0|end-of-life counseling benefit actually 
20101228043639.000|20101228043641.000|TR0|became law under President Bush.  The only 
20101228043641.000|20101228043643.000|TR0|thing new here, the official says, is a 
20101228043643.000|20101228043645.000|TR0|regulation allowing these discussions to 
20101228043645.000|20101228043648.000|TR0|happen as part of the patient's yearly 
20101228043648.000|20101228043650.000|TR0|checkups or what they call wellness

20101228043856.000|20101228043858.000|TR0|intellectual honesty which is to say that 
20101228043858.000|20101228043900.000|TR0|there is absolutely no reality here.  
20101228043900.000|20101228043902.000|TR0|There's nothing based in fact in the term 
20101228043902.000|20101228043904.000|TR0|"death panel".  It doesn't exist. It's 
20101228043904.000|20101228043907.000|TR0|completely voluntary.  It puts power in 
20101228043907.000|20101228043909.000|TR0|the hands of patients which is where it 
20101228043909.000|20101228043911.000|TR0|needs to be.
20101228043911.000|20101228043913.000|TR0|
20101228043913.000|20101228043915.000|TR0|KAYE:  Nancy, would you like to respond?
20101228043915.000|20101228043918.000|TR0|
20101228043918.000|20101228043920.000|TR0|PFOTENHAUER:  Certainly.  Name me a single 
20101228043920.000|20101228043922.000|TR0|country that has put this level of 
20101228043922.000|20101228043924.000|TR0|government intervention into their health 
20101228043924.000|20101228043926.000|TR0|care system when they did not eventually 
20101228043926.000|20101228043929.000|TR0|end up denying care?  They call it things 
20101228043929.000|20101228043931.000|TR0|like comparative effectiveness research in 
20101228043931.000|20101228043933.000|TR0|places like England and Germany but what 
20101228043933.000|20101228043935.000|TR0|happens is they basically decide that in 
20101228043935.000|20101228043937.000|TR0|order to lower costs, patients of a 
20101228043937.000|20101228043940.000|TR0|certain age, disability or with a certain 
20101228043940.000|20101228043942.000|TR0|illness, really shouldn't have certain 
20101228043942.000|20101228043944.000|TR0|treatment options available to them.  That 
20101228043944.000|20101228043946.000|TR0|is not ok.
20101228043946.000|20101228043949.000|TR0|
20101228043949.000|20101228043951.000|TR0|This is more than the camel's nose under 
20101228043951.000|20101228043953.000|TR0|the tent and while I do believe that it's 
20101228043953.000|20101228043955.000|TR0|hyperbolic and agree that it's hyperbolic, 
20101228043955.000|20101228043957.000|TR0|the concern is legitimate.  And the 
20101228043957.000|20101228044000.000|TR0|American people, particularly elderly 
20101228044000.000|20101228044002.000|TR0|Americans are right to be worried.
20101228044002.000|20101228044004.000|TR0|
20101228044004.000|20101228044006.000|TR0|KAYE:  In fact, Nancy, what we're talking 
20101228044006.000|20101228044008.000|TR0|about here is simply patients talking with 
20101228044008.000|20101228044011.000|TR0|their doctors about advanced-care planning 
20101228044011.000|20101228044013.000|TR0|and having the government pay for it.  So 
20101228044013.000|20101228044015.000|TR0|what is so controversial about that?
20101228044015.000|20101228044017.000|TR0|

20101228044019.000|20101228044022.000|TR0|going to be advising?  Again, name me a

20101228044026.000|20101228044028.000|TR0|care system when there were not actual 
20101228044028.000|20101228044030.000|TR0|rationing that occurred?  Whether you're 
20101228044030.000|20101228044033.000|TR0|talking about back in Great Britain when 
20101228044033.000|20101228044035.000|TR0|people over the age of 45 were determined

20101228044039.000|20101228044041.000|TR0|Eventually in order to lower costs,

20101228044044.000|20101228044046.000|TR0|options.

20101228044123.000|20101228044126.000|TR0|KAYE:  It's a voluntary conversation.

20101228044130.000|20101228044132.000|TR0|conversation that is one, frankly, that we

20101228044139.000|20101228044141.000|TR0|lessen anxiety.  They lessen depression

20101228044544.000|20101228044546.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT (voice-over):  Scott Jurek 
20101228044546.000|20101228044548.000|TR0|has been called the king of pain and the 
20101228044548.000|20101228044550.000|TR0|greatest ultra- marathoner ever.  Ultra 
20101228044550.000|20101228044552.000|TR0|marathons can be 125 miles longer than a 
20101228044552.000|20101228044555.000|TR0|typical 26-mile marathon.  Scott finished 
20101228044555.000|20101228044557.000|TR0|his first in 1994 and since then, he's 
20101228044557.000|20101228044559.000|TR0|dominated the sport.
20101228044559.000|20101228044601.000|TR0|

20101228044603.000|20101228044606.000|TR0|that cover more than 150 miles and last 
20101228044606.000|20101228044608.000|TR0|over 24 hours straight.  A notoriously 
20101228044608.000|20101228044610.000|TR0|tough ultra-marathon is the 135-mile Bad 
20101228044610.000|20101228044612.000|TR0|Water in Death Valley, California.  In 
20101228044612.000|20101228044614.000|TR0|2005, to get through the 130 degree heat, 
20101228044614.000|20101228044617.000|TR0|Scott was dunked in this king-sized cooler 
20101228044617.000|20101228044619.000|TR0|full of ice water.
20101228044619.000|20101228044621.000|TR0|
20101228044621.000|20101228044623.000|TR0|Halfway through the race, he collapsed and 
20101228044623.000|20101228044626.000|TR0|for ten minutes he didn't move.  But he 
20101228044626.000|20101228044628.000|TR0|managed to get up and not only finish the 
20101228044628.000|20101228044630.000|TR0|race but shatter the course record.
20101228044630.000|20101228044632.000|TR0|
20101228044632.000|20101228044634.000|TR0|Scott says it was his mother, Lynn, who 
20101228044634.000|20101228044637.000|TR0|taught him how to persevere. She died last 
20101228044637.000|20101228044639.000|TR0|March after living with multiple sclerosis 
20101228044639.000|20101228044641.000|TR0|for 30 years.

20101228044807.000|20101228044809.000|TR0|where I got connected with the outdoors.

20101228044831.000|20101228044833.000|TR0|165.7 miles in 24 hours.
20101228044833.000|20101228044836.000|TR0|
20101228044836.000|20101228044838.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Tell me how that works.  Do you 
20101228044838.000|20101228044840.000|TR0|take breaks or what are you doing?
20101228044840.000|20101228044842.000|TR0|
20101228044842.000|20101228044844.000|TR0|JUREK:  The more time I take breaks, the 
20101228044844.000|20101228044847.000|TR0|clock is always going, so the idea is to 
20101228044847.000|20101228044849.000|TR0|continue running throughout and as much as 
20101228044849.000|20101228044851.000|TR0|you can.  You only get 24 hours.  The only 
20101228044851.000|20101228044853.000|TR0|times I did stop were to go to the 
20101228044853.000|20101228044855.000|TR0|bathroom, basically, and even eating is 
20101228044855.000|20101228044858.000|TR0|done on the run.  GUPTA:  Have you heard 
20101228044858.000|20101228044900.000|TR0|about the medical aspects of this?  What 
20101228044900.000|20101228044902.000|TR0|have you been told?
20101228044902.000|20101228044904.000|TR0|
20101228044904.000|20101228044907.000|TR0|JUREK:  Well, I think it helps -- I'm 
20101228044907.000|20101228044909.000|TR0|actually a physical therapist, and so I 
20101228044909.000|20101228044911.000|TR0|know a little bit about the body.  But you 
20101228044911.000|20101228044913.000|TR0|know, is it healthy to go that far in that 
20101228044913.000|20101228044915.000|TR0|amount of time?  It's hard to say.  But 
20101228044915.000|20101228044918.000|TR0|the human body was built for endurance.
20101228044918.000|20101228044920.000|TR0|
20101228044920.000|20101228044922.000|TR0|If you look at our ancestors and what they 
20101228044922.000|20101228044924.000|TR0|did -- I mean, even think of my 
20101228044924.000|20101228044926.000|TR0|great-grandparents and what they did for 
20101228044926.000|20101228044929.000|TR0|work out in the fields. And I think maybe 
20101228044929.000|20101228044931.000|TR0|our perception of what is normal has 
20101228044931.000|20101228044933.000|TR0|changed over the years.  And I like to 
20101228044933.000|20101228044935.000|TR0|always refer to what people used to do.
20101228044935.000|20101228044937.000|TR0|
20101228044937.000|20101228044940.000|TR0|GUPTA:  You talk about exploration.  And 
20101228044940.000|20101228044942.000|TR0|maybe, to some extent, exploring what the 
20101228044942.000|20101228044944.000|TR0|body can do.  But at some point you made 
20101228044944.000|20101228044946.000|TR0|the decision to say, I'm going to go from 
20101228044946.000|20101228044948.000|TR0|someone who didn't like to run to racing 
20101228044948.000|20101228044951.000|TR0|in the hardest, presumably, running 
20101228044951.000|20101228044953.000|TR0|competitions in the world.  Was there a 
20101228044953.000|20101228044955.000|TR0|moment when that happened for you and you 
20101228044955.000|20101228044957.000|TR0|said, "I can actually do this"?
20101228044957.000|20101228044959.000|TR0|
20101228044959.000|20101228045002.000|TR0|JUREK:  I think it was probably after my 
20101228045002.000|20101228045004.000|TR0|first 50-miler; after my first 
20101228045004.000|20101228045006.000|TR0|ultra-marathon.  I'd run a marathon and 
20101228045006.000|20101228045008.000|TR0|then a month later decided to do this 
20101228045008.000|20101228045010.000|TR0|50-mile race.  A buddy of mine, Dusty 
20101228045010.000|20101228045013.000|TR0|Olsen (ph), said, "You've got to try this 
20101228045013.000|20101228045015.000|TR0|out."
20101228045015.000|20101228045017.000|TR0|
20101228045017.000|20101228045019.000|TR0|And at 20 years old, most -- most 20 year 
20101228045019.000|20101228045022.000|TR0|olds aren't thinking about running 50 
20101228045022.000|20101228045024.000|TR0|miles, but after I completed that I said, 
20101228045024.000|20101228045026.000|TR0|of course, "Never again."  But it was 
20101228045026.000|20101228045028.000|TR0|after a few hours, and I was like, "You 
20101228045028.000|20101228045030.000|TR0|know, I can -- I think I can be pretty 
20101228045030.000|20101228045033.000|TR0|good at this."
